intro: Sphaerocionium malingii, commonly known as the Malings' globe lichen, is a species of lichen that belongs to the family Parmeliaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive yellowish-green thallus with a smooth, rounded surface. The organism forms a symbiotic relationship between a fungus and a green alga, which together contribute to its growth and survival. It is typically found on bark and stone in humid, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
